alert.note: Alert for Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Socorro, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Socorro, Magdalena, Lemitar, Bosque Del Apache Refuge, Escondida, Chamizal, Laborcita and Luis Lopez. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 129 and 160. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 107 and 138. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
